oai_dc:dc.dc:title: INTELLIGENT BEACH NOURISHMENT: THE FUTURE OF SOUTHERN BALTIC COASTAL PROTECTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bojan, Michał
Szmytkiewicz, Piotr
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Hel Peninsula is a unique and distinctive geographical feature of the Southern Baltic Sea region. A long, narrow and forested sandbar, it is a popular tourist destination thanks to its beautiful beaches, but also an object of high scientific interest. As a transitional environment between the Baltic and the sheltered waters of Puck Bay, it is a biodiversity hotspot of the region, providing a home for a wide range of flora and fauna, with some species being unique to the place.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; sediment.67
